entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation: Create an Automation to Extract Data
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to follow the tutorial provided in the link - https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-create-automation.html#ccccd52c-2a13-402b-a748-61f93dff8b62 for a demo and I am dependent on the free trial version.

However when I am trying to follow the step - 2 To open the Excel Instance: and trying to drag the open excel activity I found it is not getting dragged and greyed out but that is contrary to the content of the tutorial. Can you help me? 

 

The open and close excel activities are not working as described in the tutorial steps.

entry.title: Problem in triggering automated process in app
entry.content:
Hello i'm having some issues with a very simple tutorial, but I follow all the steps and it doesn't work like it should. The button should trigger an automated process that I uploaded to the library and that I know it's working because a tested it, but for some reason it gives me a 404 error, where should I look te fix this, because I made the project twice to keep the human error out of the box but it keeps showing even following all the steps, I have a trial account but it shouldn't be a problem as far as I know. I uploaded as much pictures to give context but I don't where I should, if you can help I would appreciate it! Thank you

This is what I got in the browser's console, when I click on the button it returns a 404 error.


 SAP Build SAP Business Process Automation by Redwood SAP Learning Solution

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation Deployment Time Out
entry.content:
Hi all,

I try deploy a automation project in SAP Build Process Automation. After some time result in Timeout error:

The SBPA service is in Region US10. The api endpoint https://spa-api-gateway-bpi-us-prod.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com

i'm thinking this is a general problem with the ABAP service.

Is anyone having a similar issue? If so, did you find the cause of it?

entry.title: SBPA failed when use "Rest Call Web Service with Destination" activity
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I tried to use "Rest Call Web Service with Destination" to call web service with destination ES5.

But it always failed with following error:

"Test Outlook job started before irpa_core.request.restCallWebServiceWithDestination activity ended. Missing await ?"
"Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'prefixUrl')",
 
The destination is passed through environment variable, and the destination is maintained in BTP and SBPA - Destination tile.
 
Any help  to achieve this would be greatly appreciated!
 
Thanks,
Pamela

entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I am trying to build an automation which accesses various S/4HANA Instances with different credentials depending who started it or which desktop agent started it. I dont want to ask the user to input their credentials. Is there a good way of handling credentials dynamically in SAP BPA?

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation reading Excel data from Sharepoint using Microsoft 365 Cloud SDK
entry.content:
I am building an automation in SAP Build Process Automation that should automatically read data from an Excel file stored in SharePoint. I used this tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-office-integration-agent..html

Previously, I used the “Get Remote File Information” activity, where I could directly provide the file URL to specify the exact Excel file in SharePoint.

Now, I want to modify my process so that it automatically retrieves the most recently added Excel file from the same SharePoint location (instead of using a fixed link), so I tried to replace “Get Remote File Information” with “Get Recent Files”.

However, the “Get Recent Files” activity does not have a field for entering a SharePoint URL or folder path, so I am not sure how to define the correct source location from which the automation should fetch the file. I also don't know how to adjust properly the new parameters, didn't see any tutorials on the Internet regarding this..

entry.title: Error occurred while sending emails in the automation in SAP Build using the Microsoft 365 Cloud SDK
entry.content:
Hi, I follow this tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-office-integration-agent..html to create an automation in SAP Build. The automation works, but the mails aren't send to any of the recipients because of this error: 

Your message wasn't delivered because the recipient's email provider rejected it.

Diagnostic information for administrators:

Generating server: PAXPR02MB7711.eurprd02.prod.outlook.com
Remote server returned '550 5.7.708 Service unavailable. Access denied, traffic not accepted from this IP. For more information please go to http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=526653 AS(7230)

When I send an email via a normal Outlook inbox from the connected Microsoft Developer Program (trial version), it is sent successfully. I tried removing the email from the blocked senders list and contacted Microsoft Support, but so far they don’t know how to help.

entry.title: SAP BPA error: When sending an array of objects, it does not load everything into the output variabl
entry.content: Hello BPA community - I have business processes where I retrieve documents from an API. I can get a maximum array of 100 documents, each document has 50 fields. When I pass this to a script to output a structure to send to an action that has an OData object, I see that not all the data is ready to be sent; it gets cut off and I see three dots. I'm sending an image.

entry.title: SAP Build - Mobile Preview not available
entry.content:
Dear community,

I wanted to create the SAP Build app following this learning documenthttps://developers.sap.com/tutorials/appgyver-create-application.html 

But however the configuration in our Build-Instance seems to be different (no trial - BTP instance plan type: build-default ). 

I don't have the possibility to preview the app on the mobile device. When choosing the objective all 3 mentioned options are there (plus Joule Skill). In the selection of the category everything looks identical to the learning ressource, but then I have only the following project types (see screenshot1). 

Following the tutorial there is then also no option to preview the app on the mobile device. 

So my question is: what might be the reason and how can I resolve this? 

 

Edit: I noticed, that there are more differences. So my assumption is, that this is related to the service type in the BTP ?

entry.title: Error creating Physical Inventory Document via API
entry.content:

{
"value": [
{

]
}
]

Here’s the minimal payload I tried so far:

entry.title: Upload a file in SAP Build apps
entry.content:
Upload a file using SAP Build apps

Hello All,

Hope you are doing well.

I am creating a web application using SAP build apps in which I want to pick file from local filesystem and pass the content of the file to a LLM configured using AI core .

I tried using the Pick Files component available in market place for achieving the upload part and was able to do so but as mentioned in the official documentation the component does not support web platform.

 

Can you guide me how I can have this functionality for web application.

Thanks & regards,

Pankaj Gupta

entry.title: @cap-js/mcp-server - Practical guide to get value on day on
entry.content:
Give your coding assistant instant, project‑aware knowledge of your CAP model and docs. With @cap-js/mcp-server, the assistant can look up entities, services, fields, and HTTP endpoints from your compiled CDS model and cross‑check official CAP docs, so it proposes the right code and changes in your editor.

Here's where I found this and would like to share with community - https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

  • Package: @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Command: cds-mcp
  • Tools: search_model (compiled CDS/CSN), search_docs (local CAP docs embeddings)
  • Works with MCP‑capable assistants in VS Code and other IDEs (e.g., Cline, Copilot Agent Mode, opencode)

Here’s the short version - just follow these 3 step

  1. Configure your IDE agent to start the server via npx:
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}
  1. Add these rules to AGENTS.md so the assistant always uses the server correctly:
- You MUST search for CDS definitions, like entities, fields and services (which include HTTP endpoints) with cds-mcp, only if it fails you MAY read *.cds files in the project.
- You MUST search for CAP docs with cds-mcp EVERY TIME you create, modify CDS models or when using APIs or the `cds` CLI from CAP. Do NOT propose, suggest or make any changes without first checking it.
  1. Optional CLI smoke test:
npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Why you’ll love it

  • Stop guessing: Fuzzy‑search your compiled model for entities, services, elements, annotations, and endpoints.
  • Fewer mistakes: Suggestions are grounded in your actual model and verified against official CAP docs.
  • All local: Fast and private, perfect for day‑to‑day development.

IDE setup

VS Code - Cline extension

Settings example:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

VS Code - GitHub Copilot Agent Mode (global mcp.json)

{
  "servers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {},
      "type": "stdio"
    },
    "inputs": []
  }
}

opencode

{
  "mcp": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "type": "local",
      "command": ["npx", "-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "enabled": true
    }
  }
}

Tip: Keep the server name “cds-mcp” in both your config and prompts so your assistant reliably calls it.

How to use it in your editor

Think “discover first, then change.” Ask your assistant to:

  • Discover model and endpoints

    • “Use cds‑mcp search_model to list all services and their HTTP endpoints. Then list entities with primary keys.”

  • Write a correct SELECT with expand

    • “Call cds‑mcp search_model for Books and its associations. Then, after checking CAP Node.js SELECT expand syntax via cds‑mcp search_docs, propose a handler that returns Books.title, Books.stock and expands auther.name.”

  • Generate precise OData URLs

    • “Find the service and endpoint for Books via search_model, then give me an OData V4 URL with $select=title,stock and $expand=author($select=name) plus a curl example.”

  • Safely change CDS/annotations

    • “Show docs for @Common.Label using cds‑mcp search_docs. Using search_model for Books, propose a minimal diff adding labels for title and stock. Include file paths.”

  • Plan a refactor

    • “We’re renaming Author to Writer. With cds‑mcp search_model, list affected entities, associations, services, and endpoints; propose a step‑by‑step PR plan.”

  • Implement an action/handler

    • “Find docs on defining and implementing a custom action in Node.js via cds‑mcp search_docs. Then sketch a minimal handler in srv/<service>.js with imports and input validation.”

Best practice: Ask the assistant to paste the search_model and search_docs results that justify any change.

CLI usage (optional but handy)

Install globally to test from your terminal:

npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Search your compiled model:
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
  • Search CAP documentation:
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Once the CLI works, your IDE agent can invoke the same tools automatically.

What the tools return

  • search_model

    • Names and kinds (entity, service, etc.)
    • Elements and annotations
    • File locations
    • HTTP endpoints where services are exposed

  • search_docs

    • The most relevant CAP documentation snippets for your query, based on local embeddings

Use both together: discover exact names/paths with search_model, confirm syntax and best practices with search_docs, then apply small, reviewable changes.

Tips for getting the most value

  • Start every task with search_model to avoid typos and stale assumptions.
  • Require docs‑backed edits: have the assistant run search_docs before proposing code.
  • Keep edits atomic: one focused change at a time, with file paths and minimal diffs.
  • Monorepo? Tell the assistant the CAP project folder to search.

Support and contribution

  • Issues and feature requests: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/issues
  • Security policy: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/security/policy
  • Code of Conduct: https://github.com/cap-js/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
  • License and REUSE info: see LICENSE and https://api.reuse.software/info/github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

Now action - 

  • Add the MCP config, paste the two rules into AGENTS.md, and ask your assistant:
    “Discover all entities, keys, and endpoints with cds‑mcp search_model, verify the Node.js SELECT docs with cds‑mcp search_docs, then propose a minimal handler change for Books.”

    SAP Business Technology Platform  SAP Business AI SAP Cloud Application Programming Model

entry.title: How to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using more than one value of this property
entry.content:
Hi,
 
We need to filter a data entity using the filter conditions input of a "Get record collection" activity in Build Apps. For this, we use the following formula in the Formula Editor:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds[0].accountTechnicalId}]}
 
appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds is the variable where we store the values needed to filter the data set. It is a list of objects with one property (accountTechnicalId).
 
The formula works well, but as you can see, we're filtering using the first occurrence of the array only ([0]), which results in showing the records filtered on this value only. We've made countless tests but they're always returning errors, for instance:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds}]}
 
So the question is: using the Formula Editor, is there a simple way to apply the filter using all the values stored in the variable? Else, is there some sort of "for each" activity or should we create a loop or use a JS script in the logic canva? Basically, the goal here is to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using one or more values of this property.
 
Thanks a lot for your help on this, we're stuck on this problem for quite some time now and we need to implement this urgently for a demo to a client next Thursday...
 
Best regards,
 
LM.
